channel.title: carvetop on Scott French
channel.description: Recent content in carvetop on Scott French

item.title: Redwood SF2 Chambered Guitar
item.description: I could write a lot about this guitar, but ultimately I'll just say that trying to finish the burl redwood I used for the top had me questioning my choice to ever get involved with guitar building. In the end, finish problems aside this guitar ended up being pretty cool and sounding really good. The SF2 is a scaled down acoustic guitar design, but really it is too traditional for me at this point and I doubt I will go any further down this path.

item.title: Buckeye Burl SF3 Singlecut Guitar
item.description: My friend Ian called one day and let me know our local Salvation Army had an absolute unit of a buckeye burl table come in that week. I dropped everything to go look and it ended up being several burls combined into one table using about 40 pounds of epoxy and fiberglass. We ruined a chainsaw blade and bandsaw blade just getting this one blank out of the table, but it was well worth it.

item.title: Claro Walnut SF3 Singlecut Bass Guitar
item.description: This was the rare instrument I actuatlly built on spec and the whole thing just went quick and easy. I lucked into this beautiful and THICK Claro Walnut body blank that just perfectly fit with this singlecut SF3 bodystyle. I already had all the hardware and electronics around so this project came together in a matter of days. It ended up going to local person with some interesting stories and a great instrument

item.title: Redwood & Maple SF3 Bowable Guitar
item.description: This SF3 came with a fairly straightforward goal: to be easy to play with a bow. Narrowing the SF3 design and doing an exagerated top carve ended up being the easy part... findings pickups and a bridge to accomodate that extreme radius was more challenging. Nordstrand was able to supply some custom NDC humbuckers with super staggered magnets for the pickups. For the bridge I used Graphtech saddles and built a very custom ebony bridge by hand.

item.title: Wenge & Mahogany SF3 Chambered Guitar
item.description: There was a time when it was very hard to find to find wenge locally so I generally grabbed it whenever it did show up. With that spirit one day I visited my most local, small town lumber store and found some HUGE wenge slabs with plenty of space for multiple one-piece tops. I bought all the clean boards and have been using them ever since. For me this guitar really was all

item.title: Black Limba & Rosewood SF3 Chambered Guitar
item.description: I don't generally aim for using woods that compeltely steal the show, but even with subdued blanks I feel like that's what ended up happening here. This black limba top and rosewood neck combo just really popped and everything came together nicely. This is a great build to highlight how material selection and more importantly a creative cut list can really impact the outcome. My memory is this was was originally a one-piece flat-sawn

item.title: Red Gum Eucalyptus SF3 Lightweight Guitar
item.description: This guitar came about when I lucked into two really nice pieces of local wood. This was easily the best billet of figured red gum eucalyptus I've ever ran into, and the grafted walnut billet was really nice too. I came up with a plan to make a very thin guitar using these woods. The inside is hollow and the edges ended up very thin. Even with very heavy solid brass bridge,

item.title: Red Gum Eucalyptus & Walnut SF3 Singlecut Bass
item.description: This bass was pretty important in the evolution of my designs as it was the first neck to utilize the overlapping headcap with individual string guides. From here I moved onto a differnt design using solid metal rivets instead of delrin rods, but this was still an important step. Some really nice local woods again here.

item.title: Red Gum Eucaluptus SF3 Singlecut Bass
item.description: This is the first instrument I built when I moved home to California. I setup most of my tools while I was building this one so there are some rough edges, but it turned out pretty nice and has been used plenty live and in the studio.

item.title: Scott's Old Guitars
item.description: Here are some guitars I made while attending The Roberto Venn School of Luthiery and my apprenticeship at the First Act Studio for Artists.
